description: Explore the origins of scientific thinking in ancient civilizations

slides.title: Welcome to Ancient Science
slides.content:
# Introduction to Ancient Science

Welcome to **Ancient Science** - where it all began!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Mesopotamia and Egypt** - Early astronomy and medicine
- **Ancient Greece** - Philosophy and natural science
- **Other Civilizations** - China, India, Maya

> **Fun Fact:** The Egyptians calculated pi to about 3.16 over 4,000 years ago!

slides.title: Mesopotamia and Egypt
slides.content:
# Mesopotamia and Egypt

## Mesopotamia (3000 BCE+):

| Field | Achievement |
|-------|------------|
| Mathematics | Base-60 system (60 seconds, 360 degrees) |
| Astronomy | Star catalogs, eclipses |
| Medicine | Diagnostic texts |
| Engineering | Irrigation, ziggurats |

## Egypt (3000 BCE+):

| Field | Achievement |
|-------|------------|
| Mathematics | Geometry for pyramids |
| Medicine | Edwin Smith Papyrus |
| Astronomy | 365-day calendar |
| Engineering | Pyramids, mummification |

slides.title: Ancient Greece
slides.content:
# Ancient Greece

## Key Figures:

| Philosopher | Contribution |
|-------------|-------------|
| Thales | Natural explanations |
| Pythagoras | Mathematics, music ratios |
| Hippocrates | Medicine, ethics |
| Aristotle | Logic, biology |
| Euclid | Geometry (Elements) |
| Archimedes | Physics, engineering |

## Greek Innovations:
- Deductive reasoning
- Natural philosophy
- Atomic theory (Democritus)
- Earth is sphere (Eratosthenes measured circumference)

slides.title: Ancient Science Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Who measured the circumference of Earth in ancient times?

slides.title: Other Ancient Civilizations
slides.content:
# Other Ancient Civilizations

## China:
- Compass, paper, printing, gunpowder
- Astronomy records (supernovae)
- Acupuncture

## India:
- Zero and decimal system
- Surgery (Sushruta)
- Astronomy (heliocentrism hints)

## Maya:
- Accurate calendar
- Zero independently
- Astronomy for agriculture

## Islamic Golden Age (750-1250 CE):
- Preserved Greek knowledge
- Algebra, algorithms (al-Khwarizmi)
- Optics (Alhazen)
- Medicine (Avicenna)

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Ancient Science Summary

## Key Contributions:

| Civilization | Legacy |
|--------------|--------|
| Mesopotamia | Base-60, astronomy |
| Egypt | Medicine, engineering |
| Greece | Logic, natural philosophy |
| China | Inventions |
| India | Mathematics |
| Islamic | Preserved and advanced |

## Foundations:
- Observation of nature
- Mathematical modeling
- Written records
- Natural explanations (not just supernatural)

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Ancient Science!
